subtitle: Shortbread topped with caramel and three kinds of chocolate.

method.text: To make the shortbread, grease a 23 cm x 28cm x 5cm tin. Cream together the fat and sugar until pale and fluffy. Stir in the flour.
Knead the shortbread mixture gently until smooth. Press evenly into the base of the tin and prick well. Cook in oven for 30 min until crisp and golden.
To make the caramel, put all the ingredients into a heavy based pan. Stir over a low heat until melted and smooth. Bring to the boil then cook for 3-5 min until golden and caramel coloured.
Remove the shortbread from the oven. Allow to cool in the tin. Spread the caramel over the shortbread base. Leave to cool.

To make the topping, melt the chocolates in three separate bowls. Stir 15 g butter into each bowl. Spread the plain chocolate in an even strip over a third of the caramel filling. Repeat this process with the milk and white chocolate, until all of the caramel filling is covered.
Leave to set in a cool place. Cut into 2 <sup>1</sup>/<sub>2</sub> cm x 7.5cm slices and serve.
